stream_context.summary: Kaze prototypes Course 12, a Western-themed ‘cowboy level.’  Most of the session is spent nailing down the art style, colour palette, fog settings and overall layout (town → valley → train HQ).  He also finalises three outlaw mini-boss concepts and receives a new music track from Badub.

development_findings.summary: Course 12 is now the active focus; earlier courses 1–11 are effectively complete.
Overall layout: Town (Area 1) → Valley playground (Area 2) → Train HQ/Gold Mine (Area 3), arranged in a U-shape round a central mountain for culling efficiency.
development_findings.quote: What if this whole city was kind of around a mountain?  That would work well for the N64 because of how much culling it allows.

development_findings.summary: Permanent moving train with two stations; additional sky-high track inspired by Wario’s Gold Mine to give constant motion and visual interest.
development_findings.quote: You will see the train drive over Mario… another train is coming from here.

development_findings.summary: Three mini-boss stars:  (1) Snifit saloon shoot-out, (2) bank-robbing Monty Mole discovered via tunnel trail, (3) five Goombas in a trench-coat after a train robbery.
development_findings.quote: Three bosses, actually, and every single one of them will be a star.

development_findings.summary: NPC & enemy roster: friendly Yoshi cowboys, Cowboy Toads, Bandits from Yoshi’s Island, Shy Guys, Pokeys, Snifits with guns, Chain Chomps; sheriff gives quests, saloon only serves milk.
development_findings.quote: The NPCs are gonna be friendly Yoshi cowboys … the saloon will only serve milk.

development_findings.summary: Visual influences: Twilight Princess hidden village, Mario Party Western Land, Wario’s Gold Mine, Yoshi Valley, Sand Kingdom; goal is a ‘goofy, cartoon’ Western not gritty realism.
development_findings.quote: I want it to be that, but for cowboys … a cowboyaboo vibe.

development_findings.summary: Art-style decisions reached: lighter, lower-contrast wood; saturated façades; blue sky with light blue fog (970-985 range) despite 2-cycle cost; roof textures still open.
development_findings.quote: I think the blue fog looks better … I think we can go with this style.

development_findings.summary: Technical note: Global fog in Fast64 forces all materials to 2-cycle, hurting performance; accepted as ‘rule of cool.’
development_findings.quote: Unfortunately, this means everything is going to be a 2-cycle material … it might just look so good that we have to take the loss.

development_findings.summary: Toolchain: Blender + Fast64 exporter into vanilla Mario 64 decomp; 64×64 textures recommended for authentic N64 limits.
development_findings.quote: There’s a plugin called Fast64.  You can just export levels from it into Decomp.

development_findings.summary: Planned workflow: (1) finalise building style, (2) draw overhead map, (3) block-out, (4) polish visuals.
development_findings.quote: This is our timeline … Sounds good.

development_findings.summary: Audio: Badub delivered a bespoke three-minute Western track incorporating the file-select motif; Kaze plans a ‘yeehaw’ jump sound.
development_findings.quote: He just sent me that … This is so perfect.

context_findings.summary: Development pace slowed after Course 9 because Kaze now holds a full-time job.
context_findings.quote: Development has slowed down ever since the end of course 9, because I have a full-time job now.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: embrace exaggerated stereotypes (‘cowboyaboo’) and prioritise the Rule of Cool over strict logic.
context_findings.quote: This is not about logic, this is about cool.

context_findings.summary: Personal stance: refuses to insert references he doesn’t personally enjoy or understand.
context_findings.quote: I would never reference something that I don’t enjoy.

context_findings.summary: Kaze discourages drinking and jokes about showing up to work in a cowboy hat; indicates attempt at work-life levity.
context_findings.quote: Drinking is just not a good thing to do. Don’t drink, it’s that simple.

context_findings.summary: Expresses indifference to Twitch’s nudity drama, calling it irrelevant to development.
context_findings.quote: I actually care so little about the whole Twitch nudity thing … How is it affecting me?

biobak.summary: Actively critiques building colours and suggests more saturation; points Kaze toward reference materials (Odyssey, Wario’s Gold Mine).
biobak.quote: Giving it the most charitable interpretation, I think what you're saying is to make them more saturated.

badub.summary: Composed and sent a new Western track mid-stream, immediately adopted as Course 12 theme.
badub.quote: Oh, he got a song … that’s so perfect.

zeina.summary: Arrives home during stream; no direct project input noted this session.

key_stories.title: Nailing the Cowboy Level’s Look
key_stories.summary: Kaze struggles to find a distinctive yet N64-friendly art style for Course 12.  After experimenting with textures, saturation, skyboxes and fog, he settles on a cartoonish palette with blue fog and saturated façades.
key_stories.challenge: Initial building textures looked bland or ‘colour vomit,’ and fog adds performance costs.
key_stories.process: Reviewed reference imagery, debated colour theory with Biobak, tested Fast64 fog, iterated textures live.
key_stories.outcome: Agreed visual direction: light blue fog, lower-contrast wood, bright façades; next step is blocking out the map.
key_stories.key_quote: Finding the art style always takes a while … I think the blue fog looks better.  I think we can go with this style.

key_stories.title: Three Outlaws, Three Stars
key_stories.summary: Course 12’s core gimmick is jailing three comedic outlaws, each rewarding a star, to reinforce the Western theme.
key_stories.challenge: Needed mission concepts that fit the cowboy narrative and varied gameplay.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed scenarios: Snifit saloon shoot-out, Monty Mole tunnelling bank heist, five Goombas in a trench-coat train robbery.
key_stories.outcome: Clear mini-boss structure established, integrating exploration, tracking and combat.
key_stories.key_quote: Every single one of them will be a star, and you will put them in jail after you catch them.

key_stories.title: Fog vs. Performance
key_stories.summary: Implementing atmospheric fog enhances the Western mood but forces costly 2-cycle materials on N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Tested Fast64 global fog, adjusted near/far values, evaluated blue vs. orange fog.
key_stories.outcome: Chooses blue fog, accepting performance hit under the ‘rule of cool.’
key_stories.key_quote: It might just look so good that we have to take the loss.

open_questions.context: Working title ‘Wild West Valley’ deemed too obvious; no replacement chosen.
questions: What alternative names are being considered?
How does the team decide on final course titles?

open_questions.context: Kaze wants traversal via train and sky tracks but is unsure how to keep the ride interactive and fun.
questions: Will the train be purely cosmetic fast-travel or have player-controlled segments?
How will platforming around sky tracks be designed to avoid monotony?

open_questions.context: Fog forces 2-cycle materials, acknowledged as heavy.
questions: Has the team benchmarked Course 12 with fog enabled?
Are fallback options planned for hardware limits?

open_questions.context: Badub supplies tracks asynchronously; implementation pipeline not discussed.
questions: How does the team handle looping, compression, and insertion of new tracks?
What feedback loop exists between composer and level designers?

open_questions.context: Zeina’s specific tasks on Course 12 not covered.
questions: What animations are planned for the cowboy NPCs?
How do Zeina and Kaze coordinate assets given their personal relationship?
